title: Ethical Instructional Design for Balancing Academic Freedom and Learning Rights

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of linguistics, understanding educational methodologies, experience in utilizing digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Emphasizing mobile-based language learning content creation and ethical instructional design competencies in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze conflicts between instructional freedom and learning rights and propose ethical solutions.
Learners can apply principles of ensuring student learning rights when designing effective microlearning modules in language education.
Learners can develop a checklist to evaluate ethical standards in instructional design for mobile learning environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
